John Gill: Which was the son of Saruch,.... The Septuagint call him Serouch." (Luke 3:35)
which was the son of Ragau; so the Septuagint, the same with Reu." (Luke 3:35)
which was the son of Phaleg; the same with Peleg, Genesis 11:18 the Septuagint reads as here: 'which was the son of Heber', or Eber." (Luke 3:35)

bhtAttempts.bht: The son of Serouch, also known as Saruch, was Ragau or Reu, which is mentioned in the Septuagint. Ragau's son was Phaleg or Peleg, who is also referred to as Heber or Eber in the Septuagint and Genesis 11:18. These genealogical details highlight the lineage and ancestry of the individuals mentioned in Luke 3:35.

The genealogical account in Luke 3:35 reveals that Saruch, also known as Serouch, was the father of Ragau or Reu, as stated in the Septuagint. Moreover, Ragau was the father of Phaleg or Peleg, who is referred to as Heber or Eber in the Septuagint and Genesis 11:18. These intricate details provide insight into the lineage and ancestry of the individuals mentioned in this verse.
